Reviews.Title: “So very convenient”
Reviews.Author: travelgal092
Reviews.Content: The Phillips Club is so very convenient....Convenient location, in the middle of so much to do; convenient for transportation....there is subway station half a block away and the bus through Central Park over to the Eastside is one block away....and if you must take a taxi, on Broadway there are always plenty to be had.....Convenient, comfortable rooms.....I usually stay in a 'studio'....it is large by any hotel standard much less NY....it has a full kitchen which is great for getting breakfast while you are dressing....it has a very comfortable bed with nice linens, a large flat screen TV with really good cable, a loveseat, table and chair for lounging, a table and chairs for eating, tons of closet space, and the only (mild) let down, a small bathroom....nice but nothing to rave about....the staff is very nice and friendly...the building well maintained....ever since finding the Phillips Club, I have stayed nowhere else in NY.....

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud21
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Phillips Club. The location is excellent. You have many stores, restaurants, movie houses, a subway station and the Lincoln Center accross the street. Also, there is a Gourmet Garage adjacent to the hotel! Service is impeccable and the staff is very homey friendly. It is pet friendly and each floor has a lounge. This is a real gem of a place. I'd wish there would be more like this!

Reviews.Title: “Best secret in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Writerguy74
Reviews.Content: While mainly an extended stay hotel, you can also do shorter stays here. They all come with a kitchen, which saves a LOT of money while in NYC. The staff is lovely and the place great. Free laundry machines on every floor so you can under pack and wash. They don't have room service or other hotel like amenities, but you are literally across the street from the subway, and lincoln center, and I could not imagine staying anywhere else. I have also stayed at the Trump which I found laughable in terms of how nasty the employees are. And the STandard downtown, while gorgeous views, have rooms so small they are laughable.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly run boutique hotel near Lincoln Center”
Reviews.Author: dehenderson
Reviews.Content: While just a bit on the pricey side, the Phillips Club has become one of our new favorite hotels in New York. Nothing beats it if attending anything at The Lincoln Center which is just a short walk. The rooms are spacious, very clean, extremely comfortable and quiet, providing for an outstanding rest. The staff is attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love this quiet hotel, kitchen and surrounding markets.”
Reviews.Author: Mamamaid
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to feel like home and most of the rooms are away from the NYC sirens and traffic noise - it's the best place to feel home away from home. Their is a kitchen with many gourmet markets near by for stocking up. Easy walking area and getting to the heart of NYC

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Timeshare option in New York”
Reviews.Author: Jpresskin
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this place. The location is great, (just two locks from Lincoln Center) All around are excellent cafes, pizzerias, grocery stores and terrific shopping. The rooms vary in size from studios to two bedroom units but each one is spacious, modern and well appointed. You could easily stay for a week or two and feel like you are home. You can access private storage and leave what you want behind for use upon your next visit.. The doormen are professional and the front desk will accept deliveries for you and place the in your room when you are out. Nice in room amenities such as a music system, Sat TV, and twice daily housekeeping. The staff is top notch and he rooms are as nice as anything. Their is 24 hour room service from 3 local eateries and they deliver good food, quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, residential feel; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RtravelG
Reviews.Content: In planning for my recent NYC trip with three friends, the Phillips Club did not show up in my hotel searches. I wasn't even aware of it until a friend made a recommendation. I'm glad we ended up staying there! The apartment-style room (with kitchen and living room) provided plenty of space. The decor is classy and everything seemed to be of fairly good quality, though some things were showing wear & tear. I wasn't expecting much from the pull-out bed in the living room, but the one in this room was just awful. Hotel staff was generally helpful, though most were not especially friendly nor did they go out of their way to ensure a pleasant visit. What I liked most about the Phillips Club were the quiet environment & upscale residential feel... and, above all, the fantastic W 66th Street location.

Reviews.Title: “Class 4 Star Hotel/Condo”
Reviews.Author: Pamba G
Reviews.Content: I just love staying at the Phillips Club. The location is wonderful. Bus pick up right outside the door, subway 100 feet, grocery store next door, spa next door, health club across the street. What more can you ask for. I have been to NYC many times before and this is the best location by far. Close to everything and easy access. You will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, feels more like home than a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SactoTraveler95819
Reviews.Content: Developed as condos, these suites are well equiped for a long stay, but perfectly reasonable for a brief visit as well. Nice staff. Grocery store right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; comfy clean building”
Reviews.Author: pugmeister2011
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice, most recently in April, 2011. You can't beat the location in a terrific neighborhood right by Lincoln Center and the Subway. I stayed in a one-bedroom, which had more than generous space. There is a full kitchen, which helps save a bundle on food expenses in NYC, since you can eat breakfast and other meals in the apartment (there is a Food Emporium supermarket across the street and uptown a block or so and a gourmet deli next door). There is a coffee pot in the room - and a bag of ground coffee, which I thought was a nice touch. The staff was attentive. I stayed here on another occasion with my children and had a very pleasant stay. Guests have gym privileges at Club Reebok, across the street. I didn't have time to go, but heard it's nice. The Phillips Club subway stop (66th / Lincoln Center) is a few stops north of the theater district and Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “A Hostile Environment”
Reviews.Author: HeatherRandall
Reviews.Content: I have never written a negative review of anything before and I had such a terrible experience at the Phillips Club that I felt compelled to write about it. I stayed there with my 2 children in January of this year and had several negative experiences. On one occasion the doorman refused to get me a taxi when I asked him and instead poitned out the door and told me to get one myself. On another occasion the porter refused to move my luggage until it was zipped to his satisfaction and when we reached my room he yelled at me for not having the key. And on yet another occasion the sofa bed was not made up for the kids our first evening and there were no sheets or pillows available in the room. When I called down I was admonished for not telling them I need the bed made and had to go downstairs and wait at the front desk for someone to get me sheets so I could make the bed myself. The worst part of all of this was that when I spoke to the manager about all of this he was nice and then did absolutely nothing to correct the problems. Even worse, when I wrote a review on Yelp, he had it "filtered" for negative content. It was bad enough that I paid luxury prices for terrible service, but that my concerns went unacknowledged and then surpressed make me incredibly furious and even more determined to let everyone know that this is aboslutely the last place on earth they should stay unless they want to pay a lot of money for hostile service.

Reviews.Title: “Our Upper West Side home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sevencousins
Reviews.Content: Manhattan is terrific, but very tough and can be daunting. Phillips Club provides a refuge where we can stock the kitchen with comfort foods from the Columbus Circle Whole Foods, nearby Food Emporium, downstairs Gourmet Garage and other take-outs we encounter. Then, relax and eat breakfast and perhaps some other meals in, and feel like real New Yorkers. Beds are comfy, with luxe linens. The East Side is just a pleasant stroll along Central Park South away. In moderate weather, we walk to the theater district. Just a few blocks south is busy midtown, which offers much, but we find too frantic and congested to call home. We are a real estate family, so we recognize that Phillips Club has location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Great for long term stay (2 years)”
Reviews.Author: meiguido
Reviews.Content: Been there for 2 years while studying in NY. i got the apt 711 and I must say that it beats any other buildings in term of services and location (2 steps from colombus circle where my university was). Maid service available at any time. Balducci is just down the building. Jsut across the street, the supermarket and the cinema. just under the bulding tower record and Victoria s secret. the location rocks ! the downside is the excessive price for long term stay (a bit more than 5500$/month). I'd definitly go back but I ll negotiate the price first.

Reviews.Title: “A great base in NY”
Reviews.Author: MartySF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times recently, and I really like coming back to it. Rooms are 1-bedroom or studio apts, with (barely equipped) kitchens so in the mornings I could eat some cereal and make some coffee... from the Balducci's right downstairs, of course. You almost feel like you have your own (rather elegant) apartment in New York. The building is in fact a mix of hotel and condo, I think. A lot of performers coming to Lincoln Center stay there, I hear. Why I'm giving it 4 stars, not 5: first, the neighborhood -- I was glad to be out of midtown or Times Square, but I wish there were some interesting shops or restaurants right nearby... maybe there is and I haven't found it yet. (Though it's steps from the 1-line subway so easy to get anywhere fast.) #2, as a hotel it's hardly full-service. People are plenty nice but it just doesn't have the services of a 5-star place.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort and space”
Reviews.Author: lagunatravel
Reviews.Content: We loved the Phillips Club. Our one bedroom apartment with full kitchen was bright, spacious and very handsomely appointed. It was well designed and maintained. It was great having use of the Reebok Club across the street which is a terrific gym ____much better than the typical hotel facility. Also, we enjoyed the neighborhood and good location. Of course, if you are looking for all the amenities that are provided in hotels, ex. room service, attention to your every whim, this may not be the place for you. There is no restaurant or bar. But, we found the staff very courteous and helpful. We felt as if we were living in the city instead of visiting tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but pricey conference venue - excellent NY location”
Reviews.Author: Mantelstone
Reviews.Content: Resided at the Philips Club throughout a five day conference for Enicore Capital earlier this month, and had a very good impression overall. The service level of the conference organizers was top drawer, although they did charge accordingly. The junior suite boasts highly impressive bathroom facilities and a view that is out of the ordinary. There were minor shortfalls with the room service, such as waiting thirty minutes for tea to arrive in the morning. However, this is a fine New York hotel venue, which I would indeed recommend to the discerned business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Love staying they”
Reviews.Author: minnie868
Reviews.Content: My parents and I love staying at the Phillips Club. We stay there almost everytime we go up. We usually take a 1 bedroom and I sleep on the couch. We like the fact that we don't step over each other in 1 room. Also we like the fact that there are two televisions and a kitchen. It helps especially in the mornings since we don't like big breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Phillips Club twice in the last couple of years. I have stayed at a lot of places in NYC and this is by far the best yet. It's extremely clean and in great condition, the staff is very friendly and eager to help. The kitchen is wonderful; we were very surprised to find full sized appliances and everything we needed. There are a lot of restaurants in NYC but sometimes it's nice just to relax at "home" and be able to fix a meal even if it's only breakfast. The hotel is in a very quiet location. You have to travel a little to get to most of the touristy attractions but a subway entrance on the corner makes it very easy. In comparison to most of the hotels in the same price range, this one is far superior! I would recommend it to anyone and often do.

Reviews.Title: “Second to none”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Without question, the finest lodging experience I have evr had. Two tiny children, spouse, and I enjoyed the subway being right across the street, as was Lincoln Center. Nearby parking garage. Staff was beyond comparison - superbly cared for at desk, housekeeping, and door. If you have the means, live here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Phillips Club is first rate in every respect. I had to laugh when I read the above review. That "Italian grocery store" is Balducci's. Arguably the finest gourmet shop in NYC. Their flagship store is attached to the Phillips Club lobby. Many Manhattanites travel a good distance to shop there. Do not miss the many varieties of smoked salmon, btw. Best selection in North America, IMHO.

HotelInfo.Name: Phillips Club
HotelInfo.Address: 155 West 66th Street, New York City, NY 10023-6501
